meanings.definition: The less strong or powerful sides of something.
meanings.sent1: The weaksides of the building showed signs of wear and tear.
meanings.sent2: She always parked on the weaksides of the street to avoid traffic.
meanings.sent3: The weaksides of the cake were devoured first at the party.
meanings.sent4: His argument crumbled at the weaksides, revealing his lack of preparation.
meanings.sent5: The weaksides of the mountain were covered in shadows, making them treacherous to climb.

meanings.definition: The sides of something that are not as effective or successful.
meanings.sent1: The weaksides of the team struggled to keep up with the competition.
meanings.sent2: She focused on improving the weaksides of her business to increase profits.
meanings.sent3: The weaksides of the joke fell flat, leaving everyone silent.
meanings.sent4: His plan overlooked the weaksides, leading to unexpected failures.
meanings.sent5: The weaksides of the painting lacked detail, making it less appealing.

meanings.definition: To make something weaker or less effective.
meanings.sent1: He tried to weaksides his opponent by spreading false rumors.
meanings.sent2: The storm began to weaksides the structure of the old house.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally weaksides the flavor of the soup by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The negative feedback started to weaksides his confidence in the project.
meanings.sent5: The constant stress began to weaksides her health, causing fatigue and headaches.
